Running the Next Page and Prev Page shortcuts causes the problem to happen again.

Unable to reproduce on a runtime workbench.. can only be reproduced on the first workbench.

To reproduce:
1.  Launch Extended Memory Block Sample from (from com.abc.sample)
2.  Add memory block
3.  Add two renderings
4.  Do a couple of steps
5.  Use the page up and down shortcut
6.  terminate the debug session

The assert exception can happen when the tree viewer in the MemoryBlocksTreeViewPane receives a context activated after it is disposed.  The content provider of the viewer becomes null and resulted in the exception.

After fixing the assert exception, the second set of exceptions no longer happen.

Fixed in MemoryBlocksTreeViewPane.
Added check to content provider before setting input.

Darin, please verify.  

I will look at why we are getting the contextActivated event later.

Thanks...
Sam
Sam, did you want to revisit this one? Should I re-open it?
Also reopening this one to investigate the context events.

I am unable to reproduce the problem anymore.  I looked at the context changed event at terminate. The only context changed event received was an empty selection event.  This is resulted from removing strackframes from a thread at termination.  I also checked to make sure that the context listener from the memory view is removed when the view is closed.

Looking at the stacktrace, it looks like the memory view is getting a context changed as a result of model changed during termination.  But I verified that this will not happen, model proxy is uninstalled upon termination.
Marking as fixed.  We will no longer get the assert exception.  I also verified that things are ok.  Will open new bugs for context changed events if the problem surface again.

traces.message: assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.
